Increasing volumes of smuggled foreign cigarettes also
result in the decline in demand for Indian tobaccos since
these cigarettes do not use any tobacco grown by Indian
farmers. On the other hand, illegal cigarettes produced
in India, use tobacco of dubious and inferior quality.
Consequently, the proliferation of duty-evaded cigarettes
leads to a drop in demand for high quality Indian tobaccos
thereby adversely impacting the incomes of farmers
engaged in the cultivation of tobacco in the country.
